# GoToMeeting

## Overview
- **Website:** https://www.gotomeeting.com
- **Category:** Video Conferencing / Online Meeting Platform
- **Description:** GoToMeeting is a world-class video conference software that makes it easier than ever to do business effectively even if you aren't in the same room. It's a popular alternative for organizations experiencing acute Zoom fatigue, offering solid integrations and high quality audio and video for business communication.
- **Status:** Active
- **Last Updated:** 2026-02-12

## Pricing Tiers

| Tier | Price (Annual) | Price (Monthly) | User Limit | Key Features |
|------|----------------|-----------------|------------|--------------|
| Free | $0 | $0 | 3 participants | 40-minute time limit, Screen sharing, In-meeting chat, Mobile support, VoIP audio, Browser support (Chrome/Edge only) |
| Professional | $12/organizer/month | $14/organizer/month | 150 participants | Unlimited meetings, No time limit, Personal meeting rooms, Screen sharing, Integrations, Administrative capabilities, Business messaging, Meeting Lock, HD video and audio, 24/7 customer support |
| Business | $16/organizer/month | $19/organizer/month | 250 participants | All Professional features plus: Unlimited cloud recording, Transcription, Note taking, Drawing tools, Mouse sharing, Co-organizers |
| Enterprise | Custom Quote | Custom Quote | Up to 3,000 participants | All Business features plus: Dedicated Customer Success Manager, Onboarding & training assistance, Volume discounts, GoToRoom add-on available |

### Notes on Pricing
- Annual billing discount: 17% savings (e.g., $12/month vs $14/month for Professional)
- 14-day free trial available for Business plan (no credit card required)
- Free plan has 40-minute time limit on meetings
- Enterprise pricing is quote-based from LogMeIn (GoTo)
- Toll-free numbers and Call Me add-ons: $5/organizer/month for Professional plan
- GoTo Webinar Lite: $20/month for up to 100 participants
- Up to 20% off for some plans through third-party discounts
- Extended trials available with promo codes

## Key Features

### Core Capabilities (All Plans)
- Screen sharing
- HD video and audio
- In-meeting chat
- Mobile device support (iOS and Android)
- Browser support (Chrome and Edge only for free plan)
- VoIP audio
- 24/7 customer support
- HIPAA compliant, end-to-end encryption
- Meeting Lock
- Risk Based Authentication

### Advanced Features (Higher Tiers)
- **Business Plan:**
  - Unlimited cloud recording
  - Transcription
  - Note taking
  - Drawing tools
  - Mouse sharing (remote control)
  - Co-organizers
  - Breakout rooms

### Enterprise-Only Features
- Up to 3,000 meeting participants
- Dedicated Customer Success Manager
- Onboarding and training assistance
- Volume discounts (custom pricing)
- GoToRoom integration (dedicated meeting room hardware)

### Limitations
- Free plan: Only 3 participants, 40-minute time limit
- Free plan: Only Chrome and Edge browser support
- Professional plan: Maximum 150 participants
- Business plan: Maximum 250 participants
- No free plan for larger organizations
- Browser limitations (free plan only supports Chrome/Edge)
- Mobile app functionality may be limited compared to desktop
- No end-to-end encryption on free plan (per some reviews)

## Add-On Products & Services

### GoTo Webinar Lite
**Brief Description:** A stripped-down version of GoToWebinar for smaller webinars

- **What it does:** Enables webinars with up to 100 participants
- **Key Features:**
  - Up to 100 participants
  - Standard webinar features
  - Basic engagement tools
- **Pricing:** $20/month
- **Availability:** Available as add-on to GoToMeeting

### Toll-Free Numbers
**Brief Description:** Add toll-free calling options to meetings

- **What it does:** Provides toll-free phone numbers for meeting participants to dial into
- **Key Features:**
  - Toll-free numbers for dial-in
  - Pay-as-you-go model for Professional plan
  - Integrated with GoToMeeting
- **Pricing:** $5/organizer/month (Professional plan)
- **Availability:** Available as add-on

### Call Me Feature
**Brief Description:** Automated callback system for meeting participants

- **What it does:** Automatically calls participants to join meetings
- **Key Features:**
  - Automated dial-out
  - No manual dialing required
  - Integrated with GoToMeeting
- **Pricing:** $5/organizer/month (Professional plan)
- **Availability:** Available as add-on

### GoToRoom
**Brief Description:** Dedicated meeting room hardware and software integration

- **What it does:** Transforms conference rooms with dedicated hardware/software
- **Key Features:**
  - Dedicated meeting room setup
  - Hardware integration
  - Enterprise-grade room systems
- **Pricing:** Enterprise quote required
- **Availability:** Enterprise plan only

## Integrations

### Integration Overview
- **Total Integrations:** 8,000+ apps via Zapier + Native integrations
- **Integration Hub:** Zapier platform + Native GoTo integration marketplace
- **Primary Categories:**
  - CRM & Sales
  - Marketing Automation
  - Calendar & Scheduling
  - Collaboration & Productivity
  - Customer Support
  - Education & Training

### Key Integrations (Detailed)

#### Salesforce (CRM)
- **Type:** Native / API
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Adds web conferencing to Salesforce dashboard, schedules meetings from Salesforce
- **Data synced:** Meeting links, participant info, scheduling data
- **Setup complexity:** Medium
- **Limitations:** May require additional configuration
- **Documentation:** Available via GoTo integration marketplace

#### Microsoft Teams (Collaboration)
- **Type:** Native / API
- **Direction:** One-way (launch from Teams)
- **What it does:** Launch GoToMeeting directly from Microsoft Teams interface
- **Data synced:** Meeting links, scheduling data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy
- **Limitations:** Launch-only integration (one-way)
- **Documentation:** Available via GoTo integration marketplace

#### Slack (Collaboration)
- **Type:** Third-party (Zapier)
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Schedule and launch meetings from Slack, notifications
- **Data synced:** Meeting notifications, links, scheduling data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy
- **Limitations:** Requires Zapier account
- **Documentation:** Available via Zapier

#### Google Workspace / Google Calendar (Calendar)
- **Type:** Native / API
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Schedule and join meetings in Google Calendar, integrate with Google Workspace
- **Data synced:** Calendar events, meeting links, scheduling data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy
- **Limitations:** May require Google Workspace account
- **Documentation:** Available via GoTo integration marketplace

#### Zoho CRM (CRM)
- **Type:** Third-party (Zapier)
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Build web conferencing into Zoho CRM, schedule meetings from CRM
- **Data synced:** Meeting links, participant data, scheduling info
- **Setup complexity:** Medium
- **Limitations:** Requires Zapier integration
- **Documentation:** Available via Zapier

#### Microsoft Office 365 (Productivity Suite)
- **Type:** Native / API
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Schedule and join meetings in Microsoft Outlook/Office 365 calendar
- **Data synced:** Calendar events, meeting links, scheduling data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy
- **Limitations:** Microsoft 365 account required
- **Documentation:** Available via GoTo integration marketplace

#### HubSpot (Marketing Automation)
- **Type:** Third-party (Zapier)
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Integrate meetings with marketing workflows, schedule from HubSpot
- **Data synced:** Meeting data, contact information, scheduling
- **Setup complexity:** Medium
- **Limitations:** Requires Zapier account
- **Documentation:** Available via Zapier

#### ActiveCampaign (Marketing Automation)
- **Type:** Third-party (Zapier)
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Connect meetings with marketing automation workflows
- **Data synced:** Meeting data, contact info, campaign data
- **Setup complexity:** Medium
- **Limitations:** Requires Zapier account
- **Documentation:** Available via Zapier

### Integration Types Available
- **Native Integrations:** Salesforce, Microsoft Teams, Google Workspace, Office 365
- **API Integrations:** GoToMeeting REST API, Developer portal available
- **Third-Party Platforms:** Zapier (8,000+ apps), Zoho CRM, HubSpot, ActiveCampaign, etc.
- **Webhooks:** Available via API

### Integration Categories

List of categories with brief descriptions:
- **CRM:** Salesforce, Zoho CRM, HubSpot
- **Calendar & Scheduling:** Google Calendar, Microsoft Outlook, Acuity Scheduling, Calendly
- **Collaboration:** Microsoft Teams, Slack, Google Workspace
- **Marketing Automation:** HubSpot, ActiveCampaign, Mailchimp, Constant Contact
- **Customer Support:** Freshdesk, Zendesk
- **Productivity:** Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel, Evernote
- **Education:** Moodle, TalentLMS
- **Video & Audio:** Vimeo
- **Event Management:** Eventbrite
- **Forms & Surveys:** Google Forms, Quiz Maker

**Note:** GoToMeeting's integration marketplace provides access to 8,000+ apps via Zapier. Native integrations are limited but include major enterprise platforms.

## API & Developer Info

### API Availability
- **API Available:** Yes
- **API Documentation:** https://developer.goto.com/GoToMeetingV1
- **Developer Portal:** https://developer.goto.com/
- **Webhooks:** Yes (via API)

### Developer Access
- **Public API Docs:** Available (public documentation)
- **Rate Limits:** Not documented publicly (varies by plan)
- **Authentication:** OAuth 2.0
- **SDKs/Libraries:** .NET and Java SDKs available (source and binary formats)

### Documentation Quality
- **Public Documentation:** Professional, well-structured API documentation available
- **User Documentation:** Comprehensive help center and knowledge base
- **Support Access:** Developer support portal and community
- **Training Resources:**
  - API documentation guides
  - SDK documentation
  - Changelog
  - Partner resources

**Research Note:** GoToMeeting has a professional developer portal with REST API documentation. SDKs are available for .NET and Java. Authentication is OAuth 2.0 based. Public documentation is well-maintained but rate limits are not publicly documented.

### Support Channels
- **Phone:** 24/7 support available (all plans)
- **Email:** Available through support portal
- **Chat:** Live support available
- **Helpdesk:** https://support.goto.com/

### Response Time
- SLA details not publicly specified
- 24/7 support for all plans (as advertised)

### Documentation Quality
- **Knowledge Base:** Comprehensive knowledge base available
- **Training Platform:** Online training resources and webinars
- **Onboarding:** Onboarding assistance available (Enterprise plan)
- **User Guides:** Detailed user guides available

### Community & Learning
- **Training Programs:** Online training resources, webinars
- **Events:** Product webinars, virtual events
- **Newsletter:** GoTo product updates newsletter
- **Blog:** https://www.gotomeeting.com/resources/blog
- **User Testimonials:** Generally positive reviews for paid plans

### Training & Onboarding
- In-person training: Available for Enterprise customers
- On-demand training: Online resources and video tutorials
- Certification programs: Not specified
- Migration assistance: Available for enterprise customers

## Evaluation Notes

### Pros
- Affordable pricing compared to competitors (slightly cheaper than Zoom)
- High-quality audio and video
- Robust security features (HIPAA compliant, end-to-end encryption)
- Extensive integration options (8,000+ via Zapier)
- Professional-grade video conferencing
- Unlimited meetings on paid plans
- Good screen sharing and collaboration features
- 24/7 customer support
- Strong API for developers
- Good alternative to Zoom for organizations experiencing Zoom fatigue
- Cloud recording and transcription (Business plan)
- No time limits on paid plans
- Mobile app available (iOS and Android)

### Cons
- Free plan is weak compared to competitors (40-minute limit, 3 participants only)
- Free plan browser limitations (Chrome/Edge only)
- Lower participant limits compared to Zoom (150 vs 300 on equivalent plans)
- No end-to-end encryption on free plan
- Some user reviews mention poor audio quality compared to competitors
- Limited native integrations (relies heavily on Zapier)
- Pricing can add up for larger teams
- Mobile app functionality may be limited compared to desktop
- Late to market with free plan

### Alternatives
- **Zoom:** Better free plan, more participants on paid plans, more popular, but more expensive for paid plans
- **Google Meet:** More affordable, better integration with Google Workspace, but limited features
- **Microsoft Teams:** Better for Microsoft 365 users, more features, but can be complex
- **RingCentral:** Includes phone system, more business features, but higher price
- **Cisco Webex:** Enterprise-grade, strong security, but more expensive
- **BlueJeans:** Good for enterprise, but smaller market share

### Use Cases

#### Ideal For:
- **Small to medium businesses:** Professional plans suitable for SMBs
- **Organizations experiencing Zoom fatigue:** Good alternative to Zoom
- **Businesses needing reliable video conferencing:** High-quality audio/video
- **Teams needing screen sharing and collaboration:** Strong collaboration features
- **Businesses requiring HIPAA compliance:** HIPAA compliant plans available
- **Organizations with developer teams:** Strong API for custom integrations
- **Teams with diverse tool ecosystems:** 8,000+ integrations via Zapier

#### Not Ideal For:
- **Large enterprises needing 3,000+ participants:** Enterprise plan goes up to 3,000 only
- **Organizations needing completely free solution:** Free plan too limited
- **Teams requiring unlimited participants:** Participant limits apply
- **Organizations with tight budget constraints:** Paid plans required for full features
- **Teams needing native integrations only:** Relies heavily on Zapier
- **Individual users who don't need features:** Free plan too limited

### Key Differentiators
1. **Affordable pricing:** Slightly cheaper than Zoom for equivalent paid plans
2. **High-quality audio/video:** Industry-leading audio and video quality
3. **Strong security:** HIPAA compliant, end-to-end encryption on all plans
4. **Extensive Zapier integration:** 8,000+ apps via Zapier platform
5. **24/7 support:** All plans include 24/7 customer support

## Research Methodology Notes

**Sources Accessed:**
1. SoftwareSuggest.com (https://www.softwaresuggest.com/gotomeeting) - Pricing and basic features
2. TrustRadius (https://www.trustradius.com/products/gotomeeting/pricing) - Detailed pricing plans
3. Tech.co (https://tech.co/web-conferencing/gotomeeting-pricing) - Comprehensive pricing and feature analysis
4. Zapier Integration Page (https://zapier.com/apps/gotomeeting/integrations) - Integration information
5. GoTo Developer Portal (https://developer.goto.com/) - API and developer documentation
6. Web search results for GoToMeeting integrations and features

**Limitations Encountered:**
1. GoToMeeting official website (goto.com, gotomeeting.com) blocked by Cloudflare security (403 errors)
2. Several review sites (SoftwareAdvice, GetApp, SaaSworthy) blocked by Cloudflare
3. Limited direct access to official pricing page
4. Enterprise pricing requires direct contact with vendor
5. Some integration details limited to Zapier platform overview

**Recommended Next Steps for Complete Evaluation:**
1. Contact GoTo sales team for enterprise pricing quote
2. Set up 14-day free trial to test Business plan features
3. Research specific financial advisor use cases and compliance needs
4. Evaluate API capabilities with actual testing
5. Compare specific features against Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams
6. Investigate GoToRoom hardware integration for conference rooms
7. Research partner/reseller programs for potential discounts
